item.title: AI for Stroke Outcome Prediction
item.description:
üß† Postdoctoral Research at AIstroSight ‚Äì AI for Stroke Outcome Prediction

üî¨ Role:

Postdoctoral Researcher at Inria AIstroSight, in collaboration with Hospices Civils de Lyon (HCL)

üí∞ Funding:

This research is conducted within the AIstroSight team at Inria, focusing on the intersection of AI and neurology for stroke patient outcomes.

üéØ Scientific and Technological Objectives

The early inflammatory response after an acute ischemic stroke (AIS) plays a crucial role in patient recovery. This research aims to:

  1. Identify immune system signatures in patients experiencing loss of autonomy post-thrombectomy.
  2. Analyze gender-based recovery differences to improve personalized stroke care.
  3. Develop AI models to predict post-stroke outcomes and explore explainability methods to ensure trust in predictions.

üîç Research Approach

1. Statistical & Graphical Analysis for Clinical Interpretation

‚úÖ Replicated key statistical and graphical analyses from a prior study (originally focused on age) to examine gender differences in stroke recovery.
‚úÖ Applied Subgroup Discovery (SD) on biomarkers to identify patient-specific risk intervals.
‚úÖ Developed a manual interpretation framework with clear thresholds, similar to standard blood test markers, enabling physicians to make quick prognoses without requiring computational tools.

2. Machine Learning for Predicting Loss of Autonomy

‚úÖ Expanded the dataset to include medical history, MRI report descriptions, and additional features.
‚úÖ Implemented supervised learning models to predict functional outcomes post-stroke.
‚úÖ Assessed explainability techniques (SHAP, LIME, counterfactual analysis) to:

  • Identify gender impact in stroke recovery predictions.
  • Evaluate the consistency of different explanation methods for medical decision-making.

üè• Clinical and Computational Collaborations

  • Dr. Metchouff ‚Äì Physician at Hospices Civils de Lyon (HCL)
  • AIstroSight Team, Inria ‚Äì Research group specializing in AI applications in healthcare

üì¢ Dissemination and Publications

I am a postdoctoral researcher with the AIstroSight team at Inria, collaborating with Dr. Metchouff, physician at HCL (Hospices Civils de Lyon).

We investigate early inflammatory signatures linked to clinical outcomes in acute ischemic stroke (AIS) patients. My objective is to identify immune system signatures in patients experiencing post-thrombectomy autonomy loss and to understand gender-based recovery differences.

I replicated key statistical and graphical analyses from a related study (originally focused on age), adapting them to examine gender and clinical evolution. This approach was designed to present results in a format familiar to physicians, thereby highlighting the advantages of AI-driven analysis. Subgroup Discovery (SD) on biomarkers identified population-specific intervals. From these findings, I proposed a manual interpretation framework with clear thresholds, similar to standard blood test markers, allowing for rapid prognoses without computational tools.

In parallel, I am exploring machine learning on a broader set of features (including medical history, MRI report descriptions, etc.) to predict loss of autonomy. I am also evaluating various explainability methods (SHAP, LIME, and counterfactual analysis) to study gender impact in predictions and assess the consistency of different explanations obtained.

This research aims to bridge AI and clinical neurology, offering more personalized prognostic tools for stroke patients. üöÄ
